thread.title: Comment on Pitino will not attend ACC Media Day by leon singleton
thread.title_full: Comment on Pitino will not attend ACC Media Day by leon singleton

author: leon singleton
title: Comment on Pitino will not attend ACC Media Day by leon singleton
text:
Article written by Mrs. Tyler Thompson No, I will not make you a sandwich, but you can follow me on Twitter @MrsTylerKSR or email me . 20 responses to “Pitino will not attend ACC Media Day” BigO October 23, 2015 at 4:02 pm | Permalink | Reply 
That is a cowardly move….. Pitino's Good Nut October 23, 2015 at 4:08 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Ummmm, they gonna be ho’s at Media Day? If not then I’m out. I gotta find me another set up man and get this ho train back on track to do some recruitin’ Really? October 23, 2015 at 4:08 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Really Rick? Your counsel is advising you to not talk about this situation but you’re running that mouth all over the place about Magee stepping up and telling the truth, aka Bullying. chad October 23, 2015 at 4:10 pm | Permalink | Reply 
I hope the grammar police are on full alert that week CoolFrood October 23, 2015 at 4:12 pm | Permalink | Reply 
I am surprised UofL is allowing media access to its athletes at this time. I expect at least one eye-raising quote to accidentally result from these kids being interviewed by experience media professionals. Stevo October 23, 2015 at 4:15 pm | Permalink | Reply 
I don’t think the NCAA has told him not to talk. Roy Williams hasn’t missed an ACC media day and they have been under investigation for years. An attorney for UL/Pitino has told him not to talk so as not to incriminate himself. Barstool@Thoroughbred October 23, 2015 at 4:18 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Maybe he won’t be the coach next week? Bobbum man October 23, 2015 at 4:35 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Yeah Definitely a coward move. Sure don’t want to make the likes of roy williams and none im any worse. The ACC is a mess right now, just need to wait for the hammer to drop on UNC and UL, UNC tbey will delay delay delay but it’s inevitable they’ll get something, it’s too massive of an issue L1CWHORE October 23, 2015 at 4:35 pm | Permalink | Reply 
To Fake Lou’s point, those Louisville prostitutes can’t spell very well. 
Thoroughbred or THOROBRED? Do they serve fish there, it looks like a fish restaurant. Air Raid October 23, 2015 at 4:41 pm | Permalink | Reply 
He announced this 10 days ago but I guess no one paid attention then. Big Perm October 23, 2015 at 4:51 pm | Permalink 
Yep, said it at the uofl lunchon last week. It was in the paper the next day. J-Dub421 October 23, 2015 at 4:52 pm | Permalink 
Yeah, and how many times has Pitino said a player was suspended indefinitely, then played that player pretty much immediately? BigBlueSkyDog October 23, 2015 at 4:57 pm | Permalink | Reply 
“Louisville players Damion Lee, Mangok Mathiang and Trey Lewis WILL represent the school at Media Day,” 
Who? October 23, 2015 at 5:19 pm | Permalink 
You probably know them as ’21 feet of Suck” October 23, 2015 at 5:16 pm | Permalink | Reply 
I have a couple of things to say about this post: 
1) Regardless if Rick announced this a few weeks ago it’s a terrible move on his part to skip media day yet send his players into the line of fire…not how a leader should be. 
2) The Thorobred Lounge used to confuse the hell out me when I was a kid. I grew up in that area of Louisville and since it’s just down the road from Churchill I always thought that was where the jockeys ate dinner. 
3) I’m tired of this story…but it just won’t die. vince October 23, 2015 at 5:22 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Great photoshop October 23, 2015 at 5:31 pm | Permalink | Reply 
I really want to know what Facebook Siva Sr. has to say about this. Tommycatsfan October 23, 2015 at 6:07 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Let me get this right. Pitino, who hasn’t shut up about this in his never ending attempt to dump this on someone other than himself, can’t go to ACC media day because he isn’t allowed to talk about subject he hasn’t stopped taking about? It would be cowardly and upsetting to fans for this tool to resign from his $50,000,000.00 gig and allow UL to move away from the embarrassment that is Pitino, but it’s cool to send three kids to media day to try to clean up his mess? Sounds about right. Only thing more incredible than this circus, which I love, laugh about and hope never ends, is UL fanbase tolerance of this! They really are DuhVille. P1cWhore! Joe October 23, 2015 at 6:25 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Leave the man alone KSR,We would not be the power house we are today without Rick Pitino..Sure this is messed up,Sure he will probably lose his job..Dies he deserve this from our fan base,NO!!!We are Kentucky,Act like it… leon singleton October 23, 2015 at 6:38 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Louisville should use the North Carolina defense That others besides players used the hookers. Post Comment - New and Improved (not really, it just works now)
